Benedetta Liberatori

PhD Student

Benedetta Liberatori is currently working towards a PhD at the University of Trento, Italy. Her research interests lie in the area of computer vision, with a focus on vision-language models for video understanding.

Research Experience

Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Trento, Italy
, Deep Visual Learning Lab
Mentor: Elisa Ricci, Yiming Wang
Research state-of-the-art methods for video anomaly detection and develop a method to detect anomalous activities. The Deep Visual Learning Lab conducts research in the areas of deep learning and computer vision, developing novel methodologies for image and video understanding

Honors and Awards

2021
First Ascent
Selected as one of the twenty computer science & software engineering students for the First Ascent Italy event: all-expenses-paid, four-day event in organized by Bending Spoons.
2020-2022
SISSA Scholarship
Awarded of one of the four scholarships by SISSA, founding partners of the MSc and among the most famous Research Centers in the scientific field. The scholarship is merit-based and covers full support for two years.
2017-2020
BSc Excellence Course
Admitted as one of the thirty members of the Excellence Course within the BSc Degree. The program consisted of additional courses and tests. The grade point average bounded the admission.
